abstract: Planned closing of futures trading pits at Chicago Mercantile Exchange inside Chicago Board of Trade building will eliminate dozens of jobs and signifies end of way of life that was in many ways iconic of the city and a particular time; profession has largely been eclipsed by advances in technology; demise also closes off career path that for more than 150 years allowed those with blue-collar background to attain wealth.
lead_paragraph: The pits where traders once bellowed out orders for wheat, corn and cattle contracts are scheduled to close this summer, eliminating dozens of jobs and, for many, a way of life.

headline.main: As Silence Falls on Chicago Trading Pits, a Working-Class Portal Also Closes

snippet: The pits where traders once bellowed out orders for wheat, corn and cattle contracts are scheduled to close this summer, eliminating dozens of jobs and, for many, a way of life.
